snippet: Registrations of new passenger cars in May in the European Union rose by 4.5 percent from a year earlier, the ninth straight month of gains.
abstract: European Automakers Manufacturers' Association reports that registrations of new passenger cars in euro zone rose by 4.5 percent from year earlier; growth highlights how Europe's auto market is continuing to slowly regain ground lost since financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: Registrations of new passenger cars in May in the European Union rose by 4.5 percent from a year earlier, the ninth straight month of gains.

headline.main: European Auto Sales Continue to Climb
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Car Sales Up Again After Steep Drop in Crisis
